thread.title: Football: 'QB 1: Beyond the Lights' debuts on Feb. 15
thread.title_full: Football: 'QB 1: Beyond the Lights' debuts on Feb. 15 - LA Times

author: Eric Sondheimer
title: Football: 'QB 1: Beyond the Lights' debuts on Feb. 15
text:
A 10-part docuseries following three highly regarded high school football quarterbacks, including Tate Martell of Las Vegas Bishop Gorman, will debut on Feb. 15 on Complex Networks’ Rated Red on Verizon's go90.
“QB1: Beyond the Lights” profiles three athletes, each committed to NCAA Division I football programs, who are entering their final year before they leave behind the families, friends and teams who have supported them since the beginning of their journeys, in pursuit of furthering their dreams. The series is an intimate look at the quest for the American dream, as seen through the lens of the nation’s top high school quarterbacks aspiring for NFL greatness.
 Peter Berg, who directed "Friday Night Lights," is one of the executive producers, along with Steve Clarkson, a Southern California-based quarterback coach.
The other quarterbacks followed are Jake Fromm from Georgia and Tayvon Bowers from Pennsylvania.
For the latest on high school sports, follow @LATSondheimer on Twitter
